item.title: SURPASS Team Publications
item.description: SURPASS in the Press 2021 Quarter of known bee species have not been recorded since 1990 by Patrick Barkham, The Guardian - Fri 22 Jan 2021 The number of wild bee species recorded by an international database of life on Earth has declined by a quarter since 1990, according to a global analysis of bee declines. Researchers analysed bee records from museums, universities and citizen scientists collated by the Global Biodiversity Information Facility, (GBIF)a global, government-funded network providing open-access data on biodiversity.
